page.title: 05HISTORY OF GLENROTHES
page.content: FROM 1957 NEW INDUSTRIES BEGAN TO POUR INTO GLENROTHES eg. THE SCOTTISH MILK MARKETING BOARD AND BECKMANS. WITH THE CLOSURE AT THE ROTHES COLLIERY IN 1967 THIS LEFT A BIG SPACE IN GLENROTHES AND THIS HAD TO BE FILLED BY NEW INDUSTRIES. IT WAS DECIDED THAT GLENROTHES WOULD CATER FOR THE GLASGOW OVERSPILL AND SO THEY WOULD FILL SOME OF THE HOUSING SPACES . WITH THE NEW INDUSTRIES THE POPULATION OF GLENROTHES RAPIDLY INCREASED AND GLENROTHES SOON BECAME ONE OF THE MAJOR PLACES IN SCOTLAND FOR ELECTRONICS. TO CATER FOR THE INCREASE IN POPULATION,NORTH GLENROTHES WAS EXPANDED AND AREAS SUCH AS BALFARG, CADHAM, COLLYDEAN AND PITCOUDIE WERE BUILT AND SCHOOLS WERE BUILT IN COLLYDEAN AND PITCOUDIE.
